Module webutils¶

Documentation¶

webutils.grabFtpFile(host, dirn, filen, saveas=None, username=None, password=None)[source]¶

Download a file from an ftp server.

Parameters:
  • host – The host ip (e.g. ftp.unibe.ch).
  • dirn – The directory in the host server, where the file is located (e.g. /aiub/CODE/).
  • filen – The name of the file to download (e.g. COD18650.EPH.Z).
  • saveas – How to save the file in localhost (e.g. copy.txt); if not set, the name filen will be used.
  • username – The username to connect to the ftp site (if any).
  • password – The password to connect to the ftp site (if any).
Returns:

In sucess, a tuple is returned; first element is the name of the saved file (absolute path), the second element is the name of the file on web.
webutils.grabHttpFile(url, files, saveas)[source]¶

Download file(s) from an http webserver.

Parameters:
  • url – The server’s address; do not append the the filename to be downloaded.
  • files – A list of files to be downloaded from the given url.
  • saveas – The name(s) of the corresponding saved files.
Returns:

A list of tuples, containing (each) the web file and the (absolute path of) the saved file.

Will download the file ‘http://my.server.org/foo/bar/file1.txt‘ and save it to ‘/home/lol/sf1.txt’ and also download ‘http://my.server.org/foo/bar/file2.txt‘ and save it to ‘$(PWD)/sf2.txt’.
